description: Front porch extension (including partial demolition of existing front addition); replacement ground and first floor front and rear windows; part single; part two-storey rear extension (following demolition of existing rear extension); removal of ground floor side window; new first floor side window; rear dormer roof extension (including conversion into habitable space); front rooflights and removal of rear chimney.
decision_conditions: The proposed front porch extension, in conjunction with the existing addition by reason of the combined height, width, depth including squat appearance and design would result in a dominant, incongruous and visually intrusive addition that would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original dwelling, relationship with the adjacent properties along Cedars Drive and Bishops Close, detrimental to the visual amenities of the streetscene. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012), Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).

The proposed part single; part two-storey rear extension alongside rear dormer roof extension and resultant crown roof, by reason of the combined height, width, depth including boxy design would result in a disproportionate, dominant, incongruous, excessively sized and visually intrusive extension to the property that would fail to harmonise with the architectural composition of the original dwelling, relationship with the adjacent properties along Cedars Drive and Bishops Closem  detrimental to the visual amenities of the streetscene and character of the wider area. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (2012), Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), Policies DMHB 11, DMHB 12 and DMHD 1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).

On this decision notice policies from the Councils Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies appear first, then relevant Local Plan Part 2 (2020), then London Plan Policies (2021). Hillingdon's Full Council adopted the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies on 8 November 2012 and the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 on 16 January 2020.
